definition: to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum

sentences.english: Jenny is showingher sister Susan what she's bought for Amelia.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮向苏珊显摆她买给艾米莉亚的礼物。

sentences.english: Xiao Li is a person who likes to show off the good things he gets.
sentences.chinese: 小李是个“献世宝”，有点好东西总是喜欢显摆。

definition: to show off/to make a display of
to put on airs/to be ostentatious
to parade one's wealth/to be ostentatious and extravagant
to embarrass oneself/to make a fool of oneself
variant of 裝屄|装屄[zhuang1 bi1]
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
to make an exhibition of oneself/to be a disgrace
to show off one's military strength (idiom); to strut around/to bluff/to bluster
